alert.note: Alert for Nicholas; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:18PM EST until January 04 at 1:52PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River at Blue Licks Spring affecting Robertson and Nicholas Counties. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Licking River at Blue Licks Spring. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Cropland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 25.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet overnight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.3 feet on 06/18/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
